comment: He's a nice guy but a ridiculously weird grader for an HON1100 class. I completed all the requirements for an assignment, but he took off a lot of points for "not being as detailed as possible". It was an annoying class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: There are a LOT of papers and a LOT of reading!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: He's very nice and passionate about the subject. I had a small class so we had discussions sometimes and got to do some cool activities. There are essays instead of tests which can be overwhelming sometimes but the material is easier to write about than memorize. (maybe).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Overall great professor. You will have to write essays, but there are no test. Class discussion is very involved, but you will not enjoy if you are not interested in Anthropology. Great teacher, I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Dr. Ellwanger is an attentive and demanding professor who expects the best out of all of his students. He is engaged and intelligent, holding himself to the same standards that he holds his students. You will learn a lot in his classes, and even though participating through group discussion can be scary, it is worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Ellwanger for two classes this semester, and I hope I have him for a billion classes in the future. Incredible at lectures, essays as opposed to quizzes, and super friendly. Gives detailed feedback and happily answers questions. Love ya, Dr. E.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment: He consistently demonstrates a high degree of empathy, dedicating himself to ensuring comprehensive understanding among his students. The course involves extensive reading and substantial essay/written assignments, with an absence of traditional tests. In summary, he exemplifies exceptional teaching qualities, I highly recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Sweet teacher, but very lecture-heavy, and he graded us on our participation. For a 1 credit class it was a bit of an overkill. ATTENDANCE MATTERS
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: You will get an easy 100 in this class as long as you follow the instructions for each assignment (there weren't many). He assigned readings, but you are not tested on them whatsoever. He was very sweet and understanding and his lectures weren't too bad to sit through. If you are looking for a chill and easy class, he's your choice for HON1100.

Professor Ellwanger's class was probably my favorite experience at Kennesaw State. He has a genuine enthusiasm for what he is teaching and puts in the effort to make sure students feel comfortable and willing to participate. I did not read the textbook, but just attended each lecture and took notes, and finished the class with a 4.0.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Solid class, I am not very interested in Anthropology but he certainly is. He is passionate about his work and is willing answer any questions you have on the subject. The course was three essays instead of exams, discussion posts, and a presentation. There were books to read, but I found them to be more interesting than books from other courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Personally, I HATED taking the Honors course. While it was not challenging, it felt that a lot of it was busywork. Video lectures were extremely long (40-60 minutes) for a class worth one credit hour. Professor. Ellwanger is a very nice man, however. The days we went to class were fun and enjoyable, unlike the rest of the online class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Respected

comment: Professor Ellwanger is amazing and wants you to succeed. Take him if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Ellwanger is so sweet and very knowledgeable. I was in the honors course, so it was more discussion-based, meaning I didn't have tests. HOWEVER, he gave us 3 "topical essays" that were 20% each, and was a very meticulous grader. To do well on these and any other assignment, YOU HAVE TO DO THE READINGS (and it's a good bit of it too.)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ellwanger is very kind and always open to conversation. It's not his fault, but we have so much busywork to do. There's long videos and readings. Some assignments are given to you months in advance with no reminders of when they're due. Write everything down and when it's due! If you're focused & motivated, you'll do fine in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: He is a decent guy who cares about you as a person but by far the most boring professor I have ever had at Kennesaw. The assignments are easy, but this dude doesn't know how to stop talking and isn't that spectacular. I have had him for a couple of classes now and he was mediocre in both. Tests can be ridiculous though with the time limit given.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him for Honors, great professor and an even better person, goes above and beyond to show students hes here to help and teach.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: One of the best professors Ive ever had! Go to class and take notes! The lectures are in-depth, but interesting. I had a 75 minute class at 8 am. Its doable. The reading was well within a manageable range and the tests accurately reflected what was lectured on. Hes also just a cool dude.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took him for the honors freshman seminar. There are readings every week, so you need the textbook. We basically had to journal every day (daybooks) and 10 of those are graded. Two projects, two papers, and participation grades. Class was informative at times. His grading can be a little confusing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He's an amazing professor. There are 3 required novels assigned and they're quick reads. If you read them and take good notes on his lectures you will make an A. He was kind and was always available for questions. 10/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Caring

comment: A very nice and caring professor, he willing to work with you if you put in the effort. Very lecture heavy and participation is necessary for notes. No textbook but other, smaller books were used. Often a lot of reading before each class but very do-able. Tests were easy and reflected what was taught. A very great teacher!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Most amazing professor. His lectures are a bit boring, however, if you write down everything on the slides and then make a Quizlet or something similar based on his lecture outlines, (which he posts online for each lecture) you will literally get 100s on the tests. 2 quizzes a week based on A LOT of reading, but it's doable. Such a great guy too!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took Ellwanger for intro to Anthropology. Hes a very nice guy, and begins to know you by name as the semester carries on. His tests are very hard and long. Studying weeks before the test is mandatory if youre hoping to get an A!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Grades consist of three exams, and two quizzes every week. The quizzes are based off of various readings, and he expects you to read A LOT. He makes you buy multiple books, and you only use the book for a few chapters. Professor Ellwanger is very knowledgeable about the material, but he is boring. Tests are also hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Worst class at KSU! There is soo much information that he tries to compile everthing in one unit. expect weekely quizzes. He grades everything hard. Two book reviews, which he grades hard. Exams arent easy at all, so dont start studying the day before cause u will definitely fail. I dont recommend this class to anyone
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Excellent Professor! Too bad hes leaving KSU and this is his last couse. Very knowledgeable and fair professor. I was taking this class as an elective and he really made me love anthroplogy. I'm so glad I took him! Please do take him if your an anthropology major, you will not regret it!!

He's a great teacher and goes really in depth in all of his lectures, but the tests are pretty huge and really difficult. He is a stickler for details and doesn't accept second rate work. You will absolutely have to read in order to pass tests and writing responses. If you're interested in Anthropology, definitely take his course.

What a great teacher! I am so glad I took this class. If you come to class, do the reading and participate in the lectures, you will get an A. His tests are harder, but he grades very fair. Hope I get to take this professor again!

Professor Ellwanger is very open and easy to approach, however, his class was not easy and should not be taken lightly. Buy and READ all of the assigned books if you want to get an A. The test are very long and difficult. He does put power points online before the test, but going to class is a MUST.

I liked Prof. Ellwanger. One book per three sub-fields of Anthro and a group paper due in each section which wasn't too bad at all. He knows his stuff and has lived it as well with the stories he told. If you participate in class he will come to call students by name which makes the class feel a bit more personal.

He is nice, the class was large so his teaching style was impersonal and lecture-based. The papers are done in groups and very easy since the work load is spread out. The exams are in class and rather specific, but if you pay attention and take notes you will pass fairly easily.

He's very passionate about what he does. You don't have to come to class but I would because his lectures make up most of the tests. Have 4 or 5 group papers that aren't that hard. Tests are confusing and very wordy. Quizzes every week online.
Entirely too many group papers. This is a college class, why are we forced to write papers with five other people.

Professor Ellwanger is a very interesting professor and knows the topic well. I had a great time in his class and got a high B. It was kind of boring but if you review your notes you will do fine. The tests were average and you dont have to read the books to do well on the reviews. I made A's on all but one B and did the papers the night before.

I thought Professor Ellwanger was a very interesting professor who genuinely wanted his students to succeed. I was a good student in high school and only studied for tests the night before and I got a B+. He is very good with email and will answer all of your questions with a smile. Great professor, I would highly recommend taking him.

Ellwanger is a great professor. His lectures and powerpoints are relevant to the subtopics discussed, and the tests were not difficult. As with all professors, teaching style will take some getting used to - but he's always willing to help you get the grade you desire. Take the time to review your notes before the test, and you will be fine.

Nick's Classes were a bit boring. You will be lost without your notes when it comes to the test, which is also challenging even if you studied. But that is to be expected from a lecture class. there were Numerous book reviews and numerous hands-on/ writing assignments. Take psych. Nick is a nice guy though, welcome to KSU, Tex.

This is the most boring class I have ever taken. He lectures the entire time, and it is very boring. You have to read three books and do reviews on them. You also have to do an assignment over each subtopic of anthropology. His class was difficult. I am usually a good student; I just did not work well with his teaching style. I would not take him.
